CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 03A02

TI_TEXT.P: Работи по подравняване на пътна настилка на пътища
Lavori di rifacimento di manto stradale
Renovação do pavimento das faixas de rodagem
Lucrări de reînnoire a îmbrăcămintei şoselelor
Obnovitvena dela na krovnih plasteh vozišč

SHORT_DESCR.P: The delivery concerns asphalting work on national and county roads in Trøndelag. The assignment comprises 4 contracts.
Contract Stjørdal comprises 19 000 tonnes of asphalt and 13 000 m2 milling, to be performed in the municipalities of Levanger, Meråker and Stjørdal.
Contract Steinkjer comprises 20 000 tonnes asphalt and 6 450 m2 milling in the municipalities of Åfjord, Indre Fosen and Ørland.

MAIN_SITE.P: The municipalities of Steinkjer, Høylandet and Grong.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Contract Namdal comprises 59,000 tonnes of asphalt and 3,100 m2 milling, and will be performed in the municipalities of Steinkjer, Høylandet and Grong.
Contract Lauvsnes comprises 40 000 tonnes of asphalt and 1 000 m2 milling, and will be carried out in the municipalities of Namdalseid and Flatanger.

SUITABILITY.P: The qualification requirements for the competition are given in points 2.2 to 2.5 below. Each individual qualification requirement must be fulfilled before a tenderer is deemed to be qualified.
Tenderers who do not fulfil the qualification requirements will be rejected, cf. § 24-2 (1) letter a).
Tenderers shall be a legally established company.
Documentation requirement:
Company registration certificate foreign tenderers can submit an equivalent certificate in accordance with the legislation in the tenderer's country of establishment.
Tenderers shall document fulfilment of the qualification requirements through:
1. A completed ESPD form.
2. A completed reply form, as stated in chapter E.
3. The requested documents under the documentation requirement for each qualification requirement cf. the provisions below.
4. Tax certificate.
Documentation as requested in accordance with nos. 1, 2, 3 and 4 shall be delivered as part of the tender by the tender deadline, cf. chapter B3 point 2.1.
It is important for assessment that the information in the documentation is correct and complete. Incorrect, misguiding or missing information can lead to rejection, cf. § 24-2 (3) letter g.

The Contracting Authority's assessment of whether tenderers fulfil the qualification requirements will, as a starting point, only be based on the submitted documentation, including any provided references. The Contracting Authority reserves the right, however, to emphasise its own experience (positive and negative) with a tenderer (and any cooperating companies, cf. point 4). The equivalent applies for other public contracting authorities´ experience. The Contracting Authority's right to request further information and clarifications is stated in point 7 with a further referral.
Tenderers shall document fulfilment of the qualification requirements through:
1. A completed ESPD form.
2. A completed reply form, as stated in chapter E.
3. The requested documents under the documentation requirement for each qualification requirement cf. the provisions below.
4. Tax certificate.
Documentation as requested in accordance with nos. 1, 2, 3 and 4 shall be delivered as part of the tender by the tender deadline, cf. chapter B3 point 2.1.
It is important for assessment that the information in the documentation is correct and complete. Incorrect, misguiding or missing information can lead to rejection, cf. § 24-2 (3) letter g.

The Contracting Authority's assessment of whether tenderers fulfil the qualification requirements will, as a starting point, only be based on the submitted documentation, including any provided references. The Contracting Authority reserves the right, however, to emphasise its own experience (positive and negative) with a tenderer (and any cooperating companies, cf. point 4). The equivalent applies for other public contracting authorities' experience. The Contracting Authority's right to request further information and clarifications is stated in point 7 with a further referral.
Chapter B3 point 6 applies equivalently in the assessment of the tenderer´s qualification requirements.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Tenderers shall have good economic and financial capacity to fulfil the contract and shall fulfil the following requirement, the tenderer´s equity shall be positive.
Information on such shall be attached with the tender. Cf. chapter E2 point 4.

If the tenderer has valid reasons for not being able to provide the documentation requested by the Contracting Authority, the tenderer can document his economic and financial capacity by presenting any other document that is relevant to the fiscal figures/economy and that the Contracting Authority deems suitable. The tenderer shall substantiate why he can’t present the documentation required by the Contracting Authority.

Before a contract is signed, the chosen tenderer shall present a tax and VAT certificate issued by a competent body in the tenderer's home country or the country where the tenderer is established, which shows that the tenderer has his tax, duty and social security contributions in order.
Norwegian tenderers can order the certificate via the Norwegian Tax Authority's website, www.skatteetaten.no The certificate must not be older than 6 months when it is presented upon request.

The contracting authorities ask that all tenderers are aware that if they are chosen as a supplier, the Contracting Authority will, when the competition is concluded, request equivalent tax and VAT certificates to that which the tenderer himself presented for each sub-supplier who will carry out work under the contract for more than 500 000 NOK excluding VAT, cf. the procurement regulations § 7.2 third section.

Tenderers can, if necessary, rely on other companies' capacity to fulfil the economic and financial capacity requirements and/or the technical and professional qualification requirements stated in point 0 and 0 above, cf. § 16-10 (1).
The following documentation shall be submitted:

— Documentation stating that the tenderer will have the necessary resources at his disposal from the companies he is relying on, for example, by presenting a commitment statement from these companies.

— Documentation for the relevant qualification requirement for the company that the tenderer is relying on in accordance with the requirements in point 0 and/or 0, as well as documentation of the qualification requirements for the company in point 0.
— Versions of the European Self-Declaration Form (ESPD) for each company as part of the tender, cf. point 6.

Where a tenderer relies on the capacity of other companies to fulfil the economic and financial capacity requirements, the Contracting Authority requires that they are joint and severally liable for the execution of the contract cf. § 16-10 (4).
Several tenderers can participate in the competition as a group, cf. § 16-11.
The participating tenderers shall, in such a case, each submit versions of the European Self-Declaration Form (ESPD) as part of the tender, cf. point 6.
The following documentation shall be submitted:
— Each individual supplier in the group shall submit the same documentation that is required for individual tenderers.
The supplier group can rely on the capacity of the participants in the group and, if necessary, rely on other companies, in this case, the requirements in point 0 apply in addition.

The Contracting Authority will assess each individual participant in the group in terms of the rejection provisions, cf. § 24-2 following. This, with the exception of the provision in § 24-2 (1) letter a) (fulfilment of qualification requirements), which will be applied to the group as a whole.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Tenderers must have sufficient experience of a relevant nature and degree of difficulty from the following work.
Documentation requirement:

A list of up to 5 but no less than 3 contracts that the tenderer has carried out or is carrying out in the last 5 years, calculated from the tender deadline. The list shall, cf. the form included in chapter E, include the following for each of the contracts:
— Name of the recipient (contracting authority).
— Description of what the contract work included, including its relevance for the qualification requirements, points 1 and 2.
— What work was carried out by the tenderer himself and what work was carried out by sub-suppliers (contract workers).
— The date of the assignment.
— The value of the contract.

— Reference person/contact person at the contracting authority with contact data (telephone number and email address) and a statement of the person in question´s role at the Contracting Authority during the contract. The tenderer is responsible for ensuring that the reference person is available and will provide a reference.
The tenderer is required to show references to relevant contracts that they themselves have carried out in a satisfactory manner.
Conditions which will be evaluated are related to, a.:
— documentation of completed quality.
— fulfilment of contracts.
— compliance with provisions and procedures for HSE.
— compliance with provisions for wages and working conditions.
— observance of deadlines.
— follow up during the warranty/claims period.
— use of apprentices.
Documentation requirement:
The qualification requirement is to be documented through the list described above in point 2.4.1.

The tenderer shall have a system that shows that he works proactively to ensure safety, health and working environment (SHA), with relevance for equivalent works as those comprised in this competition. The system shall be subject to periodic review.
Documentation requirement:
1. Description of the tenderer´s system for SHA.
2. Table of contents of the system.
3. Documentation of audits for recent years, with confirmation from the person/persons who have carried out the audits.

The provisions on rejection due to conditions at the supplier are in the procurement regulations § 24-2. The European self-declaration form (ESPD) applies as provisional documentation for, amongst other things, there not being such reasons for rejection.

Further documentation requirements for an absence of rejection reasons are in the procurement regulations § 24-7, possibly also § 24-5 (1), if documentation of such measures is relevant. The documentation shall be submitted in accordance with the communication provisions stated in chapter B1 and in accordance with the deadline set by the Contracting Authority, in cases where the Contracting Authority requests it. The certificates mentioned in § 24-7 (1) letter a) must not be older than 6 months calculated from the tender deadline.

If the required certificates/documents to document an absence of rejection reasons are not issued in the tenderer's home country, or the country where the tenderer is established, or if they do not cover all the rejection reasons mentioned in the procurement regulations § 24-2 (1) letter b, (2) and (3) letters a and b, the completed ESPD form will apply as documentation for these conditions.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Tenderers who are newly established companies and cannot submit all the documentation required under point 6 below, must be particularly careful to document and demonstrate that they have what it takes to fulfil the contract.

It is particularly important that such tenderers can document a sufficient workforce to fulfil the contract, including professional and technical competence. For newly established tenderers, emphasis is put on the fact that it is the tenderer´s ability as such to fulfil the contract that will be assessed, not individual persons' competence seen in isolation.

If a newly established tenderer has experience from contracts, the most relevant contracts that the tenderer has experience from shall be added, in accordance with the documentation requirements in point 2. This applies even if the contracts are of such a nature that they do not fulfil the stated requirements.

Missing or insufficient documentation for one or several criteria can lead to a tenderer being rejected. A missing or incorrectly completed reply form can also lead to rejection, cf. § 24-1 (2) letter b).
The Contracting Authority has made an ESPD form available for the competition notice, which all tenderers must fill in and submit together with the tender, cf. § 17-1.
If several suppliers participate in the competition as a group and/or a tenderer relies on the capacity of other companies, all the companies involved shall fill in the form.
The ESPD form applies as provisional documentation for fulfilment of the qualification requirements, as well as there not being other reasons for rejection.
